intro: Eupatorium dolichobasis, commonly known as slender boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a serrated edge, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white, appearing in clusters. Eupatorium dolichobasis is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
